Legal_Issue: Whether the Board breached natural justice or procedural fairness by proceeding with the hearing in the absence of counsel
Application_Facts: Applicants' counsel was absent due to illness; despite attempts to contact her, no adjournment was granted; the Board proceeded with the hearing; applicants represented themselves
Defendant_Behavior: Board proceeded with the hearing in absence of counsel without granting adjournment
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged breach of natural justice and procedural fairness
Legal_Standard: Proceeding without counsel is not inherently a breach of natural justice; the key is whether the individual was deprived of a fair hearing
Assessment_Factor: Applicants were able to present their case; no evidence that key documents were unavailable
Procedural_Issue: Hearing conducted in absence of legal counsel
Application_Basis: Refugee protection claim under Canadian immigration law
Relief_Sought: Judicial review to overturn decision based on alleged procedural unfairness
Governing_Rule: Natural justice and procedural fairness require a fair hearing, but absence of counsel does not automatically invalidate proceedings if fairness is maintained
Outcome: Federal Court found no breach of natural justice; application dismissed
Cause_Description: The applicants' claim for refugee protection was denied after a hearing proceeded without their counsel present
Decision_Rationale: No evidence that applicants were unable to present their case; self-representation did not deprive them of a fair hearing
Legal_Standard_Applied: Natural justice and procedural fairness in administrative hearings
